required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Mepolizumab Adjunctive Therapy for the Prevention of Asthma Exacerbations in Urban Children
clinical_study.official_title: Mechanisms Underlying Asthma Exacerbations Prevented and Persistent With Immune-Based Therapy: A Systems Approach Phase 2 (ICAC-30)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if treatment with a medication called Nucala® (mepolizumab), given along with standard asthma care, makes children less likely to have asthma attacks.

detailed_description.textblock:
Asthma is a growing problem, especially in children. It causes frequent wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, and cough. Asthma attacks, or exacerbations, are problems for children with asthma.
The purpose of this study is to see if treatment with a medication called Nucala® (mepolizumab), given along with standard asthma care, makes children less likely to have asthma attacks. Mepolizumab is a new drug that is approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for use in children with asthma who are aged 12 years and older. Mepolizumab is given by injection. It is being studied by other researchers in children aged 6-11 years.
All participants will be prescribed standard asthma medications by a clinician who is trained in asthma care. Medications will include controller medications, a rescue medication, and a medication for severe asthma attacks (prednisone). The amount of medication that participants receive may be increased or decreased during the study based on their symptoms and breathing test results. Study clinicians will treat all participants according to the same guidelines. These treatment guidelines are based on recommendations from a group of national experts in asthma. This study has been designed this way so that all participants will have safe and effective standard asthma care.
In order to enroll in this study, participants must be willing to have their asthma managed by the study clinician during the entire study period. Participants must also be willing to bring study medications to all study visits.
This study will include up to 20 study visits. Participant involvement in the study will endure for approximately 1 year.
During the treatment period, participants will be placed in one of two treatment groups:
- Mepolizumab injection and guidelines-based asthma care or
- Placebo injection and guidelines-based asthma care.
Participants will not be able to choose which group they are assigned. This assignment is random and by chance, much like flipping a coin. Participants will not know if they are receiving mepolizumab or placebo. Investigators will compare the study results between the participants of each group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4 (Treatment Initiation) to Week 56 (Completion of Treatment)
primary_outcome.description: Asthma exacerbation defined as a prescribed course of systemic steroids by a clinician or initiation of a course of systemic steroids by a participant or a hospitalization for asthma. If a participant initiates and completes a course of systemic steroids without clinician involvement, this course will be counted only if it meets the following minimum dosage: prednisone, prednisolone, or methylprednisolone at ≥ 20mg per day for 3 of any 5 consecutive days; or dexamethasone at ≥10mg per day for ≥1 day.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visits (V) 1 (Week 4 Treatment Initiation) , V4 (Week 16), V7 (Week 28), V10 (Week 40), V13 (Week 52) and V14 (Week 56, Completion of Treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: CASI scores include 5 domains: day symptoms and albuterol use, night symptoms and albuterol use, controller treatment, lung function measures, and exacerbations. To calculate CASI, the 5 domain scores are summed to determine a final score, which can range from 0 to 20, with 0 being no severity of asthma and 20 being extremely severe asthma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant Quality of Life Measured Using the Physician-Patient Global Assessment Tool
secondary_outcome.description: A validated rating scale in which a participant rates their response to therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pulmonary Function Measured by Spirometry: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) % Predicted
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visits (V) 1 (Week 4 Treatment Initiation) , V4 (Week 16), V7 (Week 28), V10 (Week 40), V13 (Week 52) and V14 (Week 56, Completion of Treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is air volume exhaled in 1 second during spirometry. Asthma severity classification for trial: mild--pre-bronchodilator FEV1 ≥ 80% predicted requiring no/ low-moderate dose of inhaled glucocorticoids; moderate--pre-bronchodilator FEV1 <80% predicted requiring no/ low-moderate dose of inhaled glucocorticoids; severe--requiring high-dose inhaled glucocorticoids with/without continuous/near continuous oral glucocorticoids, or uncontrolled despite treatment. FEV1 percent of predicted value is FEV1 converted to a percentage of normal, based on height, weight, and race. This measurement will be performed by trained and certified clinical research staff according to American Thoracic Society standards as performed routinely in usual care as part of subspecialist management of asthma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pulmonary Function Measured by Impulse Oscillometry (IOS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visits (V) 1 (Week 4 Treatment Initiation) , V4 (Week 16), and V13 (Week 52)
secondary_outcome.description: A pulmonary measure of airway resistance and reactance. This measurement will be performed by trained and certified clinical research staff according to American Thoracic Society standards as performed routinely in usual care as part of subspecialist management of asthma.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4 (Treatment Initiation) to Week 56 (Completion of Treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Time between initiation of treatment and first asthma exacerbation or the end of participant follow-up visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Reported Adverse Events (AEs), Including Their Severity and Treatment Relatedness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4 (Treatment Initiation) to Week 56 (Completion of Treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of AEs by severity and relationship to study drug will be used to assess safety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Reported Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) Inclusive of Severity and Treatment Relatedness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4 (Treatment Initiation) to Week 56 (Completion of Treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of SAEs by severity and relationship to study drug will be used to assess safety.

other_outcome.measure: EXPLORATORY: Time to First Respiratory Virus-Induced Exacerbation
other_outcome.time_frame: Week 4 (Treatment Initiation) to Week 56 (Completion of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: As measured by an exacerbation associated with a respiratory virus detected using nasal mucus samples obtained at the time of an exacerbation.

other_outcome.time_frame: Week 4 (Treatment Initiation) to Week 56 (Completion of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: Measured by an exacerbation associated with a respiratory virus detected using nasal mucus samples obtained at the time of an exacerbation.

other_outcome.time_frame: Visits (V) 4 (Week 4 Treatment Initiation) , V4 (Week 16), V7 (Week 28), V10 (Week 40), V13 (Week 52) and V14 (Week 56, Completion of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: A validated tool to assess overall asthma control (over the last 4 weeks) in participants.

other_outcome.measure: EXPLORATORY:Maximum Number of Asthma Symptom Days
other_outcome.time_frame: Week 4 (Treatment Initiation) to Week 56 (Completion of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: Defined as the highest value among the following variables over a two-week period: number of days with wheezing, tightness in the chest, or cough; number of nights with disturbed sleep as a result of asthma; and number of days on which the participant had to slow down or discontinue play/physical activities.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to treatment initiation), Week 56 (Completion of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: A measure to determine whether mepolizumab improves pulmonary outcomes.

other_outcome.measure: EXPLORATORY: Gene Expression in Nasal Lavage Samples
other_outcome.time_frame: Visits (V) 1 (Week 4 Treatment Initiation) , V3(Week 12), and V14 (Week 56, Completion of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: Whole genome transcriptomics of nasal lavage samples to identify inflammatory pathways affected by mepolizumab.

other_outcome.measure: EXPLORATORY: Gene Expression in Whole Blood RNA Samples
other_outcome.time_frame: Visits (V) 1 (Week 4 Treatment Initiation) , V3(Week 12), and V14 (Week 56, Completion of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: Whole genome transcriptomics of whole blood RNA samples to identify inflammatory pathways affected by mepolizumab..

other_outcome.time_frame: Visit (V) 1 (Week 4, prior to treatment initiation), V3 (Week 12), and Visit 14 (Week 56, Completion of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: An assay for detection/measurement of levels of antibody to mepolizumab. Analysis will include participants randomized to mepolizumab.

other_outcome.measure: EXPLORATORY:Other Potential Biomarkers Not Specified to Date
other_outcome.time_frame: Visit (V) 1 (Week 4, prior to treatment initiation), V3 (Week 12), and Visit 14 (Week 56, Completion of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: Plasma, nasal samples, RNA and DNA will be banked for possible future study of potential biomarkers associated with asthma and asthma exacerbations.

arm_group.description: Intervention: Mepolizumab plus guidelines-based standard of care asthma treatment.
Intervention: Placebo for mepolizumab plus guidelines-based standard of care asthma treatment.

intervention.description: Mepolizumab at a dose of 100 mg administered every 4 weeks by subcutaneous injection.
Placebo at a dose of 100 mg administered every 4 weeks by subcutaneous injection.

facility.name: Ann and Robert Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago
University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center
